formal_accuser.name: Procureur Général
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: Based on informations preparatoires (preliminary investigation) following community complaints

confession.devil_appearance: bon ange (initially described as good angel)
confession.seduction_context: Seduced in time of dearth by promising to ensure she always had bread. First apparition near chapel where bones of dead were assembled.

devil_mark.description: Devil marked her daughter in her presence

powder_types: white powder to cure (beaten by Persin when she used it)
sabbat_activities: discussing how to harm poor people
making caterpillars (chenilles) by mixing something in pot and throwing it in air

witnesses.name: Magdalaine servante au Sr curé de Ste Margarée

testimony.threat_quote: she would not die this time

testimony.quarrel_subject: Payment for carting hay - witness prevented husband from agreeing unless paid as much as previous year
testimony.threat_quote: sy elle estoit jenauxe, elle feroit mourir ladite deposante (if she was jealous, she would cause the witness to die)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Refusal to cart hay without proper payment
testimony.threat_quote: his wife was a witch, and he would have her burned

testimony.quarrel_subject: He had not given her some fish he had promised
testimony.threat_quote: et s'il n'avoit le moyen de fournir aux frais, il le trouvoit (and if he didn't have the means to pay for it, he would find it)

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: during three difficult childbirths at start of marriage

witnesses.name: Catherine veuve Jean Aulbert

testimony.quarrel_subject: Failure to obtain money from Jean Vanier

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day after discussing failure to obtain money

witnesses.relationship_to_accused: lodged in Laurence's house 7-8 years before

testimony.quarrel_subject: Pigs got into accused's garden, son-in-law threatened to kill them
testimony.threat_quote: qu'on ne leur donne au moings point de pouldre (that they not be given powder at least)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Taking firewood from in front of his house
testimony.threat_quote: he had 200 francs in his purse with which he would have her taken and burned if she didn't heal his animals

testimony.quarrel_subject: Refusal of hay or straw to Laurence

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after refusal of hay or straw

witnesses.name: Claude le Bailly
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: maire of village, called her witch 18 years before

witnesses.name: Colas Henriot
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: lived with father-in-law at Sainte Margaree 5-6 years before

witnesses.name: Jeniste femme Didier George le Clerc
Didielle femme au jeune Colas Demenge Henry

testimony.quarrel_subject: Escape of pigs, threat by son-in-law, remark about powder
testimony.threat_quote: Que la femme de luy deposant avoit dit des propos, desquelz ils se ressentiroient. et quant bien tous les gens de leur maison les auroient oubliées, sy en auroit elle souvenance

testimony.quarrel_subject: Wife quarrelled with accused's niece (daughter of her brother)
Laurence asked to borrow bread, wife refused

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same day as wedding invitation was declined

testimony.threat_quote: he had charge to inform against her for witchcraft

witnesses.name: Jean Bourguignon

testimony.quarrel_subject: Took lease of mill that Laurence's son-in-law had hoped for

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after taking lease at Saint Valentin

witnesses.relationship_to_accused: took mill lease that her son-in-law wanted

testimony.quarrel_subject: dispute while lodging with aunt (the accused) during military billeting

timeline.subject: Laurence femme George Jolbay
timeline.details: Informations preparatoires against Laurence, commonly noted and reputed as a witch, poisoner and empoisoner

timeline.subject: Laurence femme George Jolbay
timeline.details: First interrogation, denies witchcraft but admits to quarrels and being called witch

timeline.subject: Laurence femme George Jolbay
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses, admits some disputes and threats, reveals encounters with 'bon ange'

timeline.subject: Laurence femme George Jolbay
timeline.details: Change de Nancy orders that she be tortured 'mediocrement'

timeline.subject: Laurence femme George Jolbay
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture - confesses to witchcraft, malefices, sabbat attendance, names accomplices

timeline.subject: Laurence femme George Jolbay
timeline.details: Confirms all confessions, changes timing of daughter's seduction

timeline.subject: Laurence femme George Jolbay
timeline.details: Change de Nancy passes death sentence

timeline.subject: Laurence femme George Jolbay
timeline.details: Laurence confirms confessions but discharges her daughter of all accusations

timeline.subject: Laurence femme George Jolbay
timeline.details: Note that sentence has been carried out

accomplices_named.context: Named when threatened with further torture

accomplices_named.context: Named when threatened with further torture

accomplices_named.name: Colas Cunin
accomplices_named.context: Named when threatened with further torture

accomplices_named.context: Named when threatened with further torture

accomplices_named.context: Named when threatened with further torture

Mathieu Blaise
accomplices_named.context: Named after another turn on rack

accomplices_named.name: wife of Jean peu de Cuyr
accomplices_named.context: Named after another turn on rack

accomplices_named.name: la femme Stablo
accomplices_named.context: Named after another turn on rack

accomplices_named.name: daughter of Laurence (unnamed)
accomplices_named.context: Initially accused of being seduced by Persin and sharing in malefices, later discharged by mother

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme George Jolbay (to witness 2)
notable_quotes.french: sy elle estoit jenauxe, elle feroit mourir ladite deposante
notable_quotes.english: if she was jealous, she would cause the witness to die
notable_quotes.context: Threat made to Catherine femme Mengeon Valentin via chambermaid

notable_quotes.speaker: Witness 7's wife
notable_quotes.french: qu'on ne leur donne au moings point de pouldre
notable_quotes.english: that they not be given powder at least
notable_quotes.context: Response when son-in-law threatened to kill pigs

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme George Jolbay (at 'couraille')
notable_quotes.french: Que la femme de luy deposant avoit dit des propos, desquelz ils se ressentiroient. et quant bien tous les gens de leur maison les auroient oubliées, sy en auroit elle souvenance
notable_quotes.english: That the witness's wife had said things, for which they would feel the consequences. And even if all the people of their house had forgotten them, she would have memory of them
notable_quotes.context: Threatening remark at the 'couraille' about remembering offenses

notable_quotes.speaker: George Jolbay (Laurence's husband)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il vouldroit qu'elle fut ja bruslée sy elle est telle
notable_quotes.english: that he would want her already burned if she is such
notable_quotes.context: Response when maire told him of suspicions against his wife

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme George Jolbay
notable_quotes.french: mais que quant elle n'est courroucée a la personne, elle est une tres bonne chrestienne de femme, et qu'elle at receu beaucoup de biensfaicts d'elle
notable_quotes.english: but when she is not angry at the person, she is a very good Christian woman, and she has received many good deeds from her
notable_quotes.context: Speaking about 'la tante du curé' during interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme George Jolbay
notable_quotes.french: Qu'il y a longtemps qu'on luy impose ce faict, et il y a plus que vingt ans pense elle bien, qu'on la soubconne pour une sorciere
notable_quotes.english: That it has been a long time that this has been imposed on her, and she thinks well that it has been more than twenty years that she has been suspected as a witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme George Jolbay
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle faisoit beaucoup de choses a son tres grand regret, mais elle y estoit contrainte par la cruauté de son Mre Persin, qui les tourmentoit de battre quant on ne voulait faire a sa guise
notable_quotes.english: that she did many things with great regret, but she was constrained by the cruelty of her Master Persin, who tormented them with beatings when they didn't want to do as he wished
notable_quotes.context: Confession under torture about being forced to do malefices

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Violle (to Laurence)
notable_quotes.french: et s'il n'avoit le moyen de fournir aux frais, il le trouvoit
notable_quotes.english: and if he didn't have the means to pay the costs, he would find it
notable_quotes.context: Threatening to have her burned for witchcraft

relationships.evidence_text: her daughter, wedding feast for one of her daughters
her son-in-law had chased them out, food and wine had been given by her son-in-law
lodge with his aunt, the accused
quarrelled with accused's niece (daughter of her brother)
her mother had already been suspected
Catherine femme Mengeon Valentin, Mengeon Valentin repeated wife's story

relationships.person1: Jeniste femme Didier George le Clerc
relationships.evidence_text: Jeniste, femme Didier George le Clerc

relationships.person1: Didielle femme au jeune Colas Demenge Henry
relationships.evidence_text: Didielle femme au jeune Colas Demenge Henry
Magdalaine servante au Sr curé de Ste Margarée
had been living with father-in-law Nicolas Demenge Henry

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over economic transactions: refusal to cart hay without proper payment (witnesses 2-3), failure to obtain money from Jean Vanier (witness 6), dispute over mill lease (witness 19), refusal to lend bread (witness 17), promise of fish not fulfilled (witness 4). Laurence herself claimed poverty as reason for not seeking legal reparation when called witch.

harms_catalog.harm_description: Child born dead after extremely difficult labor lasting 3-4 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Various quarrels, women decided not to call Laurence as customary
Refusal to cart hay unless paid as much as previous year

harms_catalog.victim_name: child of Catherine femme Mengeon Valentin
harms_catalog.harm_description: Child became very ill, unable to eat bread for 3 years, remained thin and wasted
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after horse death, around St. Martin

harms_catalog.harm_description: Three very difficult childbirths, children had to be forcibly dragged from mother dead
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Did not give her fish he had promised
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: at start of marriage to present wife

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Failure to obtain money from Jean Vanier
harms_catalog.method_alleged: unspecified, witness heard terrible noise in night

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Pigs got into garden, son-in-law threatened to kill them, wife said not to give them powder

harms_catalog.victim_name: pig of Diez George le Clerc
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Warning about taking firewood from in front of house

harms_catalog.victim_name: two cows of Diez George le Clerc
harms_catalog.harm_description: Two fine cows became ill, later recovered after confrontation
Girl aged 6 became ill and died after languishing for a year
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: languished for a year before death

harms_catalog.victim_name: several beasts of Didier George le Clerc
fine cow of Didielle femme au jeune Colas Demenge Henry
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Pigs escaped into garden, threatened they would repent

harms_catalog.harm_description: Sickened and died, claiming Laurence had given her the illness

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Did not attend wedding feast for daughter

harms_catalog.harm_description: Afflicted with leg trouble, could not stand, later recovered after receiving food from Laurence
Developed serious leg trouble, couldn't stand, no remedy could be found, recovered in two days after receiving food from Laurence
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Took lease of mill that Laurence's son-in-law had hoped for
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after taking lease at Saint Valentin
harms_catalog.method_alleged: mal donné par une sorciere (illness given by a witch) according to devin d'Anould

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute while lodging with aunt during military billeting

harms_catalog.harm_description: Great hailstorm of St. Jean devastated grain crops
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Laurence femme George Jolbay and accomplices at sabbat

material_culture.context: Nicolas Hougney's wife refused to lend bread; child unable to eat bread for 3 years; Persin promised always to have bread
Dispute over carting hay, refusal of hay or straw
Pigs escaping into gardens, pig worth 10 francs
Multiple cows dying or becoming ill
Bull of Nicolas Demenge Henry died
Promise of fish not fulfilled by Demenge Violle
Dispute over taking firewood from in front of house
Plate of milesses sent to miller Jean Musnier
Two glasses of wine sent to miller
Magical powder given by Persin for maleficia, white powder for curing
Garment taken from Laurence with hidden place to hold powder
Three sorts of herbs from her garden to cure leg trouble
Diez George le Clerc claimed to have 200 francs to have her arrested
Used at sabbat to mix substance for making caterpillars

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial, residence of accused and most witnesses
Location mentioned in connection with billeting, residence of some accomplices
Location of accomplices Colas Cunin and wife
Market town, residence of maire Nicolas Hougney
First apparition of 'bon ange' on way to church

spatial_references.place_name: chapel where bones of dead were assembled
spatial_references.context: First apparition of bon ange near this location
Met bon ange on way to market at St. Dié

spatial_references.place_name: house of Maire Claude le Bailly
spatial_references.context: Demenge Violle found Laurence by fire in this house
Witness went to journee, where Jean Vanier appeared with dead child
Jean Bourguignon took lease of mill
Location of devin (diviner) consulted by miller
Residence of accomplice Margo veuve Mengeon Hidoult
Residence of accomplice la femme Stablo
Burned by Monsieur de Polleviller, used to date marriage
Location where sabbat activities took place

historical_context.military_details: Companies of regiment of Marquis de Baden billeted in Remomeix and other villages, causing displacement. Reference to Monsieur de Polleviller burning Ramberviller (used to date Laurence's marriage).
weather_events: Great hailstorm of St. Jean some 3-4 years before trial which devastated grain crops
economic_hardship_indicators: Laurence seduced in time of dearth
Laurence described herself and husband as 'pauvres gens' (poor people)
Claimed poverty prevented seeking legal reparation when called witch
On way to market when hungry 'sans son gendre elle eut heu bien faim' (without her son-in-law she would have been very hungry)
religious_calendar_references: St. Martin (around which child's illness occurred)
Christmas (before which child began to eat)
feste of Sainte Margaree (when food sent to miller)

legal_context.redress_outcome: Never sought reparation because she lacked the means to go to law; if she had used the little she had, afterwards she would have been a 'cocquine'
legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Persin visited her in prison to encourage her; costillon taken from her

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Approved torture 'mediocrement' (moderate) on 16 July 1592; passed death sentence on 24 July 1592

hearsay_chains.content: that soon after Laurence said of her that she would not die this time
told him that Laurence had been heard to say that he had not given her some fish he had promised, and that he would repent
had great suspicion that for having refused accused hay or straw, he had suffered great harm to his livestock
that Laurence had made hostile remarks about him taking the mill lease

emotional_state_notes: hesitation when admitting to being called witch
spoke positively of 'la tante du curé' when not angry

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: qu'il advient beaucoup de maladies aux personnes, Qu'eulx mesmes en ont heu de tres grandes comme chacun scait (that many illnesses happen to people, that they themselves have had very great ones as everyone knows)
insisted that Diaz George le Clerc had done her wrong

third_parties.name: chambermaid of Catherine femme Mengeon Valentin
third_parties.context: Asked to tell Laurence they suspected her

third_parties.name: daughter of Demenge Violle by earlier marriage
third_parties.context: Told father that Laurence had been heard to say he would repent for not giving fish

third_parties.name: Jean Vanier
third_parties.context: Child suffocated in cradle after failure to pay money owed

third_parties.name: Mengeon Ferry
third_parties.context: Called Laurence witch and said she should be burned

third_parties.name: Claudon Raquel
third_parties.context: Suffered great harm to livestock after refusing hay or straw

third_parties.name: Jean Musnier
third_parties.context: Afflicted with leg trouble, recovered after receiving food

third_parties.name: devin d'Anould
third_parties.context: Diviner consulted by Jean Bourguignon, identified Laurence as cause of illness and prescribed cure

third_parties.name: Monsieur de Polleviller
third_parties.context: Burned Ramberviller (used to date Laurence's marriage)

third_parties.name: Marquis de Baden
third_parties.context: Commander of regiment billeted in area

third_parties.name: Persin (Mre Persin)
third_parties.context: Devil who seduced Laurence, gave her powder, forced her to do malefices, beat her, appeared as 'bon ange', visited her in prison

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony showing pattern of quarrel-threat-harm. Strong evidence of long-standing reputation (20+ years). Confession obtained under torture with extensive details about sabbat, accomplices, and malefices. Notable elements include consultation with diviner, cures effected by sending food, and accusation later retracted against daughter. Military context (billeting) provides historical dating. Economic hardship and poverty clearly documented.
